metadata.title: CVE-2023-21400 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
In multiple functions of io_uring.c, there is a possible kernel memorycorruption due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-205-generic - 5.4.0-205.225
linux-image-5.4.0-205-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-205.225
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-205-generic - 5.4.0-205.225
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-205-lowlatency - 5.4.0-205.225
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic - 5.15.0-82.91~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-82.91~20.04.1
